Comments_List: As a student in global history, I was not aware of many of the debates animating the course. I was very happy to learn them and gain knowledge of the stakes in environmental history.

The assigned reading were interesting and very balanced. Professor Coen is an excellent seminar leader and ensured that our discussion remained on point. 

The course could benefit from a few bridge texts/background reading given the varying backgrounds of the group.

I was exposed to several new authors and learned more about the historiography of science and imperialism. I particularly enjoyed when we were able to connect and contrast readings from different weeks. However, I did not feel the course was as coherent as I would have liked. A reading course such as this is likely to be somewhat idiosyncratic, but I would still have preferred more of an arc to the course as a whole.
Yes. For students interested in histories of knowledge, ideas and environment as well as about the comparative history of empires, this could be very useful course.
